org.modelio.api.modelio.diagram

Interface ILinkPoint


  • public interface ILinkPoint
    Represents a ILinkRoute point.

    A ILinkPoint is one of the point that compose a link. It may be an anchor point at the connection extremities or a bend point.

    A bend point may be either automatic or fixed.

    • automatic points may be freely modified or deleted by the connection router,
    • fixed bend points will not move unless the connection route is not consistent.
    An anchor point may be a sliding or a fixed anchor:
    • anchors may be located anywhere on the node. They will often move to align with the adjacent bend point or the opposite anchor if none.
    • anchors are predefined anchors whose location is determined by the node. setLocation(Point) will not move the anchor. Instead it will select the nearest anchor from the requested location.
    Since:
    5.1

    • Method Detail

      • getKind

        LinkPointKind getKind()
        Returns:
        true if the point is manual, false if it is automatic.

      • getLocation

        default Point getLocation()
        Returns the location of the point relative to the connection. The returned value is a copy that may be freely modified.
        Returns:
        the location of the point relative to the Connection

      • getLocation

        <P extends Point> P getLocation(P out)
        Fills 'out' with the location of the point relative to the connection. 'out' is returned for convenience.

        This method may be used to save Point allocations.

        Parameters:
        out - The point to fill with the location
        Returns:
        out, containing the location of the point relative to the Connection

      • setLocation

        ILinkPoint setLocation(Point val)
        Changes the link point location.

        Note : the router will make best effort to satisfy the requested location but the final point location may be different than the requested one. This is particularly true for anchor points.

        Parameters:
        val - The point to fill with the location
        Returns:
        out, containing the location of the point relative to the Connection

      • setKind

        ILinkPoint setKind(LinkPointKind val)
            throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Changes the link point kind.

        The valid kinds depend on the modified link points: some kinds are valid only for anchors, others only for bend point.

        Parameters:
        val - The point to fill with the location
        Returns:
        out, containing the location of the point relative to the Connection
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when the given kind is not valid for this link point.

      • x

        int x()
        Returns:
        the location x coordinate.

      • y

        int y()
        Returns:
        the location y coordinate.
